channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Iran drops plan to buy Airbus superjumbo
item.description: The state-owned Iran Air said it will no longer be buying the twin-deck A380 aircraft from Airbus as part of its efforts to renew its fleet, according to state news agency IRNA.

item.title: Syria: Evacuations from besieged eastern Aleppo resume
item.description: The United Nations Security Council is set to vote Monday on a draft resolution which would allow the UN to monitor the process of evacuations of people from bombarded Aleppo, Syria.

item.title: How long will Trump's Russian honeymoon last?
item.description: In the 25 years since the fall of the Soviet Union, the US-Russia relationship has waxed and waned. But could President-elect Donald Trump's campaign bromance with the Russia leader be about to change that?

item.title: Pakistan lifts ban on Bollywood movies
item.description: Hit by declining revenues, Pakistani movie theaters will resume showing films from India

item.title: Russian dissident: Vladimir Putin will use hacking tactic again
item.description: Exiled oligarch Mikhail Khodorkovsky believes Vladimir Putin is savoring the widespread belief he influenced the US election, and warns that the Russian president will likely repeat the ruse of appearing to hack western democracies in the years ahead.

item.title: Hacking investigation battle heats up
item.description: Republicans outraged at Russia's alleged meddling in the US election -- and frustrated at some in their own party for not taking on the issue more aggressively -- are turning to an unlikely new source of pressure for action: Democrats.

item.title: South Korea: Powerbroker at center of presidential scandal faces court
item.description: Choi Soon-sil, the woman who may have brought down South Korea's president, appeared in court on Monday, charged with abuse of power and fraud.

item.title: 5 things for Monday, December 19: Drones, hacks and votes
item.description: Drones, hacks and votes

item.title: College kid coming home with mumps? Here's what to know
item.description: A parent who suspects their returning college student has the mumps needs to verify the diagnosis and then protect the rest of the family, an expert advises.

item.title: Electoral College set to make Trump's win official
item.description: The 538 members of the Electoral College are set on Monday to make President-elect Donald Trump's victory official.

item.title: Duckworth cautions Trump: 'We're not a military junta'
item.description: Donald Trump's decision to fill key Cabinet and White House positions with recently retired military generals threatens the tradition of civilian leadership of the military and government, says retired Army combat veteran and incoming Senator Tammy Duckworth.

item.title: For your eyes only: Moscow's top secret Cold War relics
item.description: From bunker cities to the ekranoplan flying boat, Moscow is a time capsule for Cold War history buffs

item.title: Malaysia: Myanmar's Rohingya crisis a threat to regional stability
item.description: Myanmar's treatment of its Muslim Rohingya minority threatens to undermine the region's security and stability, Malaysia's Foreign Minister said Monday at a rare international meeting to tackle the crisis.

item.title: From immigrant to elector: 'I am living the American dream'
item.description: Meet Ash Khare -- one of the 538 people who make up the Electoral College who today will cast their votes for president.

item.title: New photos of Russian T-50 stealth fighter
item.description: The world is getting a fresh look at Russia's newest stealth fighter jet -- the twin-engine Sukhoi T-50 jet -- after images of it were posted on the manufacturer's website.

item.title: Obama says Democrats lost by not showing up
item.description: President Barack Obama faulted his party's campaign strategy in an interview airing Monday, arguing Democrats suffered stinging electoral losses in last month's vote because they failed to campaign in hard-hit rural areas.

item.title: Zsa Zsa Gabor dies at 99
item.description: Zsa Zsa Gabor, the Hungarian beauty whose many marriages, gossipy adventures and occasional legal scuffles kept her in tabloid headlines for years, died Sunday.

item.title: Five enduring mysteries about Trump's victory
item.description: Trump's victory makes it clear that this was a campaign of great mystery and for all that we know, a lot remains to be uncovered, says Julian Zelizer

item.title: Janet Yellen in focus; Dow flirts with new record; Nintendo crushed
item.description: Here's what you need to know about the markets before you start your business day.

item.title: Nintendo's stock is down 11% since Super Mario Run came out
item.description: Nintendo's stock has been racing downhill since the release of its eagerly awaited smartphone game Super Mario Run.

item.title: 'Mysterious power over humanity': How cats affect health
item.description: Pet owners like to say that caring for their dog or cat confers health benefits, mental as well as physical. But what do we know about how having a cat affects our health?

item.title: The other migrant crisis: Thousands risk journey through Latin America
item.description: Tens of thousands of migrants are heading to the United States via Latin America -- a journey that leaves them vulnerable to crime, hunger and human trafficking.

item.title: Aleppo girl Bana evacuated from war-ravaged city
item.description: A 7-year-old girl who captured the world's attention by sending tweets from Syria's war-ravaged city of Aleppo has been evacuated with her family, a medical charity said Monday.

item.title: Federer, Sharapova, Serena: 2017 the year of tennis comebacks
item.description: If 2016 in tennis was a season of firsts, 2017 is all about comebacks. Roger Federer and Maria Sharapova -- among other grand slam winners -- make their returns.

item.title: What drugs were the Nazis on, anyway?
item.description: A new book claims that Nazi officials took meth, cocaine and painkillers. If so, here's what the drugs might have done to their brains.

item.title: Corpus Christi residents can use tap water again
item.description: All water restrictions have been lifted in Corpus Christi, Texas, authorities said Sunday.

item.title: 2016 in review: The revenge of the forgotten
item.description: Never has there been a more humbling year for a reporter: Predictions were shattered, polls discredited, facts eschewed and rationality dismissed.

item.title: Apple and Ireland go on offensive against EU's $14B tax bill
item.description: Apple and the Irish government are launching a two-pronged attack on the European Union's record $14 billion ruling against their tax deal.

item.title: Hipster Nativity features Mary and Joseph taking selfies
item.description: A new Hipster Nativity set ($130) depicts one filled with the Three Wise Men on Segways, and Mary and Joseph posing for selfies with Baby Jesus.

item.title: An unusual look at some of the world's densest megacities
item.description: Using double exposure, a technique that combines two images, British photographer Jasper James juxtaposes dense cityscapes with lone individuals.
